Package eu.ciechanowiec.conditional

Class Action<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.ciechanowiec.conditional.Action<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of value returned in the result of action execution
    public class Action<T>
extends Object
    Entity that can:
    1. execute a predefined command in a void manner (see execute());
    2. execute a predefined command and return the result of that execution (see get(), get(Class)).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Action

        public Action​(Callable<T> engine)
        Constructs an action based on the passed Callable.

        Contrary to an action based on a passed Runnable, this constructor constructs an action which in the result of its execution returns a value computed by the call of a Callable.call() method belonging to the passed Callable. Therefore, type parameter of an action constructed with this constructor is strongly recommended to describe the type of value that is supposed to be returned, e.g. Action<String> (see examples below).

        Example:

        
 Action<String> actionOne = new Action<>(() -> "Hello, Universe!");

 Action<String> actionTwo = new Action<>(() -> {
   System.out.println("Hello, Universe!");
   return "How can I help you?";
 });

 int num = 10;
 Action<String> actionThree = new Action<>(() -> {
   if (num % 2 != 0) {
     throw new Exception("The passed number must be even");
   }
   return "The passed number is even";
 });
        Parameters:
        engine - used for method calls of a constructed action

      • Action

        public Action​(Runnable engine)
        Constructs an action based on the passed Runnable.

        Contrary to an action based on a passed Callable, this constructor constructs an action which in the result of its execution always returns null. Therefore, type parameter of an action constructed with this constructor can be defined with a wildcard: Action<?> (see examples below).

        The passed Runnable is wrapped into a Callable. As a result, the execution of this action is performed via nested method calls. Firstly the wrapper Callable.call() method is called that subsequently:

        1. calls the wrapped Runnable.run() method;
        2. returns null.

        Example:

        
 Action<?> actionOne = new Action<>(() -> System.out.println("Hello, Universe!"));

 Action<?> actionTwo = new Action<>(() -> {
   System.out.println("Hello, Universe!");
   System.out.println("How can I help you?");
 });
        Parameters:
        engine - used for method calls of a constructed action

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Executes this action.
        1. Execution is performed via calling a Callable.call() method of the underlying Callable.
        2. If this action was constructed with the use of Runnable, then calling a Callable.call() method of the underlying Callable causes the call of a Runnable.run() method belonging to the Runnable wrapped into the underlying Callable: 
          
     Action.execute()
        └──Callable.call()
              └──Runnable.run()
        3. A return value that is produced in the result of execution of this action is discarded.
        4. This method can be called multiple times. However, in case of calling it more than once be aware of possible side effects caused by a previous call.
        Throws:
        WrapperException - if an Exception during execution of this action was thrown; in such case the thrown Exception is set as a cause of an unchecked WrapperException

      • get

        public T get()
        Executes this action and returns a return value that is produced in the result of execution of this action.

        This method can be called multiple times. However, in case of calling it more than once be aware of possible side effects caused by a previous call.

        For details on the execution see documentation for execute().

        Returns:
        return value that is produced in the result of execution of this action; if null is produced, then null is returned; if this action was constructed with the use of Runnable, then null is always returned
        Throws:
        WrapperException - if an Exception during execution of this action was thrown; in such case the thrown Exception is set as a cause of an unchecked WrapperException

      • get

        public <S> S get​(Class<S> typeToGet)
        Executes this action and returns a return value that is produced in the result of execution of this action, but cast into a specified type.

        This method can be called multiple times. However, in case of calling it more than once be aware of possible side effects caused by a previous call.

        For details on the execution see documentation for execute().

        1. Example with String: 
          
 Callable<String> callableWithString = () -> "Hello, Universe!";
 Action<String> actionWithString = new Action<>(callableWithString);
 String returnedValue = actionWithString.get(String.class);
 // result: "Hello, Universe!"
        2. Example with null: 
           
 Callable<?> callableWithNull = () -> null;
 Action<?> actionWithNull = new Action<>(callableWithNull);
 String returnedValue = actionWithNull.get(String.class);
 // result: null
        3. Example with List: 
          
 List<String> listToReturn = new ArrayList<>(List.of("Hello, Universe!"));
 Callable<List<String>> callableWithList = () -> listToReturn;
 Action<List<String>> actionWithList = new Action<>(callableWithList);
 List<String> returnedValue = actionWithList.get(List.class);
 // result: listToReturn == returnedValue
        Type Parameters:
        S - type to which the return value will be cast into
        Parameters:
        typeToGet - Class representing a type (<S>) to which the return value will be cast into
        Returns:
        return value that is produced in the result of execution of this action and cast into a specified type (typeToGet); if null is produced, then null is returned regardless of the passed typeToGet; if this action was constructed with the use of Runnable, then null is always returned
        Throws:
        MismatchedReturnTypeException - if a return value cannot be cast into a specified type (typeToGet) due to ClassCastException
        WrapperException - if an Exception during execution of this action was thrown; in such case the thrown Exception is set as a cause of an unchecked WrapperException
